intro: Pediomelum linearifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pediomelum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as small, linear leaves to reduce water loss. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Pediomelum linearifolium is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in full sun conditions.
